intro: Wahlenbergia variabilis var. krebsiana, commonly known as the variable bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
